comments:
After downloading, and md5 checking(passed) the lastest .zip file, launching the
eclipse.exe file yeilds a dialog with the following message:

Title: Eclipse
JVM terminated.  Exit code = 1
C:\Windows\system32\javaw.exe -cp C:\eclipse\startup.jar
org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main -os win32 -ws win32 -arch x86 -showsplash
C:\eclipse\eclipse.exe -showsplash 600

running the stated command on the command line using java.exe yeilds the following:
Exception in thread "main" java.lang.IllegalAccessError: try to access method
java.io.FileOutputStream.<init>(Ljava/io/File;Z)V from
 class org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main
        at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.isAlreadyRunning(Main.java:1502)
        at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:595)
You need at least a 1.4 Java VM to run 3.0 M4 or greater.  What is your VM version?
That would be it.  I'm running 1.3.1_xx.  Did I miss a relase note somewhere?

We usually don't get around to updating release notes until closer to the actual
release (R3.0 in this case is six months off).  We have another bug report for
giving the user a better error message when they are using an invalid VM version
(bug 44814).
Ok, I'll close this bug then.

traces.message: try to access method java.io.FileOutputStream.<init>(Ljava/io/File;Z)V from  class org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main
